intro: Chenopodium × bohemicum, commonly known as lambsquarters, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is characterized by its alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish flowers in clusters, followed by dry, three-angled seeds. It is native to Europe but has been naturalized in many parts of the world, including North America. Chenopodium × bohemicum is often found in disturbed soils, such as fields, roadsides, and gardens.
